SMB Enumeration ‚§µÔ∏è

I got the port 445 open and I checked it with crackmapexec Tool and I got these shares ‚Üí

As I got Backups Directory as read access so lets enumerate further more and try to access that share through mounting it on system ‚Üí

I have this share mounted lets see the file with its size ‚Üí

I have 2 file virtual hard disk(VHD) files so lets use a virtual machine to access those VHD files ‚Üí

I‚Äôm going to mount the virtual disk files and see what I can find in them. First, I‚Äôll install¬†guestmount¬†with¬†apt install libguestfs-tools, a¬†tool for mounting virtual hard disk files¬†on Linux.

I used the first vhd file and it failed to execute :

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ(kali„âøkali)-[~/Downloads/HTB/Bastion]
‚îî‚îÄ$ sudo guestmount --add ~/Downloads/HTB/Bastion/shares/WindowsImageBackup/L4mpje-PC/Backup\ 2019-02-22\ 124351/9b9cfbc3-369e-11e9-a17c-806e6f6e6963.vhd --inspector --ro /tmp/vhd1 
guestmount: no operating system was found on this disk

If using guestfish ‚Äò-i‚Äô option, remove this option and instead
use the commands ‚Äòrun‚Äô followed by ‚Äòlist-filesystems‚Äô.
You can then mount filesystems you want by hand using the
‚Äòmount‚Äô or ‚Äòmount-ro‚Äô command.

If using guestmount ‚Äò-i‚Äô, remove this option and choose the
filesystem(s) you want to see by manually adding ‚Äò-m‚Äô option(s).
Use ‚Äòvirt-filesystems‚Äô to see what filesystems are available.

If using other virt tools, this disk image won‚Äôt work
with these tools.  Use the guestfish equivalent commands
(see the virt tool manual page).

Now the second file :

‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ(root„âøkali)-[/mnt/Windows/System32/config]
